title: Wellington Potpie
directions: Season beef with salt and pepper.

In 3 ½ quart Dutch oven, over medium-high heat, warm oil. Working in batches, brown beef on all sides, 8-10 minutes per batch. Transfer to bowl. 4. Reduce heat to medium. Add prosciutto, cook until crisp, 6-8 minutes.
Add to bowl with beef. Increase heat to medium high.
Add mushrooms until tender about 8 minutes. Add to bowl with beef.
Pour off excess fat in pot. Return pot to medium heat.
Melt butter. Stir in flour, stirring constantly 2-3 minutes.
Whisk in wine and demiglace. Cook 1 minute.
Slowly whisk in stock. Bring to a simmer.
Add thyme, bay leaf, pearl onions, beef, prosciutto, and mushrooms. Lightly season with salt and pepper.
Cover pot, bake until beef is fork tender, 2-2 ½ hours.
Discard bay leaf, spoon off excess fat, stir in parsley. Increase oven to 400 degrees.
Place puff pastry sheet on lightly floured surface. Using sharp knife, score pastry 2” apart into a diamond pattern. Brush edge of pot with water.
Place pastry egg-mixture on top of dish, brush pastry with egg mixture. Press edges to seal. Trim overhanging pastry to 1”.
Transfer to oven. Bake until puffed and golden brown 20-25 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes.
ingredients: 2 ¼ lb boneless beef short ribs, cut into 1” dice
¼ lb prosciutto, cut into ¼” squares
¼ cup flour (calls for ½ cup)
¼ cup chopped flat leaf parsley
